intro: Sarcostemma apiculatum, commonly known as the hookleaf milkweed, is a climbing shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves with serrated margins and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its latex is milky and contains cardiac glycosides, which can be poisonous to animals and humans. Sarcostemma apiculatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
